circumstances: Lorraine Smith, aged 15, was reported missing from her home at 28 Cunzie Street, Anstruther. A possible boating incident was suspected, given her known interest in water activities. Her uncle, living nearby at 7 Pitreavie Court, Dunfermline, mentioned she often visited 28 Birch Avenue, Kinghorn, known for its proximity to the coast and boating opportunities. Lorraine's sudden disappearance left family and authorities concerned, though her initial risk was assessed as low. After an extensive search effort, she was found safe by the police at 18-21 Mellor Court, Rosyth, unharmed and in good health, thus closing the case without any further complications.
entities_addresses: 7 Pitreavie Court Dunfermline,28 Birch Avenue Kinghorn
q_3_explanation: Although 15, she is generally healthy and has no disabilities.
q_17_explanation: Her disappearance under suspicious circumstances is unusual for her.
q_20_explanation: Lorraine was intending to engage in water activities, which she often enjoyed.

circumstances: Lorraine Smith was last seen leaving her home at 28 Cunzie Street, Anstruther, and was believed to be heading towards the areas around Willow Crescent, Rosyth. Her grandfather and friend, Benjamin Clarke, conducted initial searches around 16 Albert Street but found no trace. Concern grew as Lorraine failed to maintain contact. Four days later, she was safely located by her family at an address on Mid Shore, with no indication of foul play or distress, confirming her well-being.

circumstances: Lorraine Smith, a 16-year-old from Anstruther, had been struggling with unpaid debts and had been avoiding social services. She had frequently spoken of disappearing. On the day she went missing, Lorraine was last seen at her home on Cunzie Street. Friends and family grew concerned when she failed to maintain regular contact. Her friend, Tom Blackburn, mentioned that Lorraine had been distant and withdrawn lately. The investigation led authorities to 22 Nicol Drive in Burntisland, where she was reportedly seen by an acquaintance. Ultimately, Lorraine was traced by staff in Rosyth after being missing for almost three days, having sought temporary refuge to avoid her financial and social predicaments.
